review_full: We, two persons, visited Amicis during our vacation in Madrid and stopped by late in the evening without a reservation. After a short wait we were shown to a table outside. The atmosphere was lively, with the place being packed and larger groups having a great time. Service was friendly and did a fair job. Foodwise, we went for various dishes to share with a bottle of wine. The standout was in our opinion the burrata, which simply was great. However, we had expected a bit more from the shared board. All in all we had a nice evening and the restaurant was a good pick.

review_preview: We ate here twice during our one week stay in Madrid. It was very nice to find a tapas bar in Madrid that offers many vegetarian dishes, all clearly marked in the menu. We tried several of their dishes, mainly vegetarian and also the Tuna...
review_full: We ate here twice during our one week stay in Madrid. It was very nice to find a tapas bar in Madrid that offers many vegetarian dishes, all clearly marked in the menu.  We tried several of their dishes, mainly vegetarian and also the Tuna tataki, and eveyrhing we ate was very good. Many of the dishes here are twists to traditional Spanish dishes such as Gazpaho and Tortilla Patatas. Their Sangria was also great - strong and very fruity. The staff were very nice and friendly, and alll of them spoke perfect English. Another great advantage of the place is that it's open straight from noon to night. We ate here at around 7pm, between lunch time to dinner time, when it's very hard to find a place that serves food anywhere in Madrid.

review_preview: My 3 friends and I had such a lovely evening at this place! When we got to the door, the lady who was seating people was super friendly and told us there would be a little wait and that we could write down our name...
review_full: My 3 friends and I had such a lovely evening at this place! When we got to the door, the lady who was seating people was super friendly and told us there would be a little wait and that we could write down our name and come back in 15 minutes. So we got a drink nearby and when we came back she recognized us straight away and led us to our table which was really nice!  All the staff was really nice to us and the vibe in the restaurant was so fun. The service was really great at this restaurant, a lot better than most other restaurants in Madrid. The people who work here give you the vibe that they really enjoy working here which really makes eating there very pleasant. The food was really good! The presentation was so fun and the taste was really good. I tried a lot of new things and there was not one thing that we order that I did not like, which was really surprising for me since I am a pretty picky eater. I would highly recommend the octopus and as a desert definitely get the caramelized thing (donâ€™t remember the name but it was amazing!) I would recommend this place if you are looking for good Spanish food with a nice modern twist to it. The price was way lower than we expected and especially for the amount of food we had and the amazing time it was more than worth it! I will definitely come back very soon!

title_review: Perfect meal in a perfect setting!
review_preview: I mean it, our experience here was perfect. The service was helpful and gracious (even though we can only stumble through a few phrases in Spanish). The setting is elegant without being pretentious. But the star of the show is the food. They start you...
review_full: I mean it, our experience here was perfect. The service was helpful and gracious (even though we can only stumble through a few phrases in Spanish). The setting is elegant without being pretentious. But the star of the show is the food. They start you off with "Galacian Bread," which is a whole grain wheat and rye bread that has a crusty shell and fresh doughy interior. We had fried artichokes as an appetizer - wow. Not greasy, breaded perfectly and served on a flavorful sauce (sorry, I donÂ´t remember what the sauce was made of). We each had fish entrees, both of which were mild white fish cooked and dressed to perfection. We topped off the meal with dessert. The Saint Honoree cake was exquisite. If youÂ´re looking for a bargain, this is not the place, but if you want a perfect meal, go to Restaurante Alabaster in Madrid. Highly recommend it.

Service was a little slow, hence the 4 rating and not a 5 but besides that I'd definitely recommend a visit!

I love the art, beer tanks and ambience in this place, Iâ€™m so glad we came here during our short weekend. Ok I should get to the food part....fresh, flavourful & beautifully paired with the right sauces. I tried the tapas 6 taster menu that comes with a Tinto. Beer or soft drink. Donâ€™t leave until you have sampled the salmon, potatoes, burrata to name a few. Amazing value at 19Euro for 6 dishes & a drink. The owner was so funny and had so much character - I even got a comp Sangria as we bet against each other and I finished the lot! Why did I win? Because the food is simply amazing! What a pleasure, and unforgettable. They have a downstairs bar/ lounge where we hear gets pretty lively - will be back!

review_preview: Alabaster was one of the highest recommended restaurants on TV and on TV that promised a lot of good. Sure the atmosphere was exclusive and the service was impressive, the food was actually not. We had leak with herring and a poached egg with veggies...
review_full: Alabaster was one of the highest recommended restaurants on TV and on TV that promised a lot of good. Sure the atmosphere was exclusive and the service was impressive, the food was actually not. We had leak with herring and a poached egg with veggies and truffle to start, it sounded better than it tasted with the leak just being a joke for â‚¬23. The mains were the hake, or star of the house, which was undercooked and just to simple to be called a star. The sauce and veggies with it didn't help. The fried veal with mashed potatoes was tasteless and crunchy and I cant recommend to order that. The desserts looked better than they tasted. Come to think of it the only things i liked where the bread and wine, which is an insult to this restaurant as it has far better things to offer. It just didn't come out at our table.  This places buzzes with corporate and embassy employees and an occasional Spanish celebrity. Its a high quality high standard place with almost impeccable service. This place has a lot going for it, location, service, atmosphere, professional to the core, great looking kitchen, but food wise we were disappointed. There are a lot of restaurants in Madrid with less service, less professional, less atmosphere where the food is a whole lot better. And less pricy as well. 3 course dinner for 2 with a bottle of wine and water at â‚¬150 is for the quality of food we had was overpriced. And that just left a bad taste in our mouths.

review_preview: Just had dinner with my wife and 14 year-old son. We made a reservation about 2 hours prior and I'm glad we did ... although I will say the hostess was doing a pretty good job of accommodating walk-ups. We don't speak Spanish which, along...
review_full: Just had dinner with my wife and 14 year-old son. We made a reservation about 2 hours prior and I'm glad we did ... although I will say the hostess was doing a pretty good job of accommodating walk-ups. We don't speak Spanish which, along with the very positive reviews, factored into our decision ... and it couldn't have been better. Our server (Laura) was fantastic ... fluent English and when I mentioned my son was limited on the kinds of food he will eat, she immediately had spot-on recommendations (even guessing correctly that he would prefer regular fries over sweet potato fries). My wife and I shared the chicken and vegetables Paella ... delicious! We also shared a liter of sangria which accompanied the meal and the warm temperatures perfectly. So ... if you're like us (non-Spanish speakers, want to try authentic and great tasting food, and want some help navigating the menu and coming up with the right choices) then this is the place for you. VOTE

title_review: Fourth  time have embraced this concpet this was by far the worst not all is the establishments fault
review_preview: Okay the positives and there were not many, People need to remember the concept is that you have lost one of your senses but you still have 4  hear, smell, taste and touch. the waiter Sam who is blind is amazing, The food was excellent...
review_full: Okay the positives and there were not many, People need to remember the concept is that you have lost one of your senses but you still have 4 hear, smell, taste and touch. the waiter Sam who is blind is amazing, The food was excellent as you have not got a clue what your eating its all about engaging your other senses . Okay on arrival you are met by 2 lovely girls and as Madrid is such a diverse city they should be able to command more than one language as in KL, Saigon and London, the front of house at all other establishments we have visited were in uniforms, trainers and jeans does not set a good concept ( just go to the restaurant chain De Maria and see what I mean). Sam took us to our table of which there were 8 of us immediately it was like being in the Atletico Madrid Stadium the Spanish with us did not grab the concept and they were shouting at each other seriously its more quite in SOL on a Saturday afternoon, unfortunately this was not quietened by the staff as in all other establishments with this concept I have frequented obviously people are nervous and talk loud to compensate initially but the waiters tell them to calm down and talk quite, I felt sorry for Sam as every time he came over he had to tell them to be quite while he explained but as soon as he had gone the noise level escalated again.  The food in the other concepts I have visited had each dish in a separate little plate but here it was all mucked in together apart from the first course and then one small plate along with a big plate for each other course and the dessert was a 2 dish course and something else I will not spoil it. The wine was not of good quality the other establishments let you chose your wine before entering for 30 euros I expected a fairly decent bottle not vinegar. I will attend this concept again but sadly never in Madrid. Unless they shut the Spanish football crowd up totally ruined the evening, Please go and experience for your selves but make it clear before you go in that you have come for diner not gone to McDonalds at the football match.

title_review: First time experience and it was amazing!
review_preview: We had the best experience attending the dinner in the dark. The entire staff, including our waitress Debbie, who was blind, were amazing. Debbie made us feel at ease, she spoke good English and translated everything for my mother (despite other couples being from Madrid...
review_full: We had the best experience attending the dinner in the dark. The entire staff, including our waitress Debbie, who was blind, were amazing. Debbie made us feel at ease, she spoke good English and translated everything for my mother (despite other couples being from Madrid and speaking Spanish). The food quality was very high and the idea of offering 4 little appetizers, then 4 little entrees and 3 small desserts was excellent, as it gave us a vast mixture of textures, smells, and tastes to guess about.  After the dinner, we had a pleasure to meet Naomi, a pretty young girl who was deaf. She taught us some sign language and it was very fun and interactive. We had a very memorable experience and happy to see that people with disabilities are able to find work, such as this project, and are happy doing it.

title_review: My third dining-in-the-dark experience; I'm a big fan!
review_preview: Having previously eaten at "dining in the dark" venues in Kuala Lumpur and London, I was eager to visit the Madrid restaurant.  Unlike in KL and London, this was an all-hands-on-plate experience, although silverware was available.  I found that I preferred eating with my hands...
review_full: Having previously eaten at "dining in the dark" venues in Kuala Lumpur and London, I was eager to visit the Madrid restaurant. Unlike in KL and London, this was an all-hands-on-plate experience, although silverware was available. I found that I preferred eating with my hands (of course, each guest had her/his own plate), because I could better explore the shape and texture of the food. Our delightful waiter was charming and made funny conversation when he served us. And, as always, the food was tasty, fresh, and well-prepared. During the "reveal" in the lighted lounge after the meal, we were told that the chef designs the menu around seasonal favorites.  I don't understand why the idea of eating "blind" scares people. The menu isn't some odd assortment that you'd find in fraternity house during pledge week, and if you don't like something, then don't eat it. The room is totally dark--no one will know you avoided the fish or the vegetables!

review_full: If you are in Madrid and want to eat something a la Gallega, here's a very good choice. Alabaster has a variety of seafood dishes prepared as if you were in Galicia. review_preview: The Alabaster restaurant is situated in a quite part pf the City Center, about 10 minutes or 15 minutes walk from the turistic center. If you don't know the place you won't find it as there no or hardly any other restaurants in the direct...
review_full: The Alabaster restaurant is situated in a quite part pf the City Center, about 10 minutes or 15 minutes walk from the turistic center. If you don't know the place you won't find it as there no or hardly any other restaurants in the direct neighbourhood. The restaurant has a Michelin star and I now understand why. The food is delicious, looks fantastic and there is something to choose. There is a good list of starters and five or six dishes for both fish and meat. The three of us took three different fish dishes and all three of them where very good. The see bass with port sauce was really spectacular, I can recommend this one. Together with a sound Albarino from the also good wine list, a perfect base for a nice dinner. Personnel is friendly, modest and professional, dishes were efficiently brought on the table. It didn't take too long or too short, just perfect. The interieur is a sort of modern and minimalistic but again, perfect for a good business dinner or to celebrate whatever occasion. Ask for a table in the center of the restaurant and beware, the restaurant opens at only at 20.30. From 21.00 on the visitors arrive and 21.30 it starts to have a very good atmosphere. We will certainly go back someday and try some of the other dishes.

title_review: The Burger was good however did I feel sick the same night
review_preview: Went there on a Wednesday evening with a friend, and ordered a 250 gram bbq burger. The burger actually tasted great, and I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. However the same night, after eating the burger, I hit the bars. I had a couple...
review_full: Went there on a Wednesday evening with a friend, and ordered a 250 gram bbq burger. The burger actually tasted great, and I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. However the same night, after eating the burger, I hit the bars. I had a couple of drinks and got a little bit drunk but not excessive. When I was on my way back home I already felt kind of sick. I had to throw up, but I didn't blame the burger for it in that moment. I thought it was because of the alcohol I drank at the bar; it seemed odd to me since I drank alcohol a much higher quantities before without throwing up. However, the next day my friend sent me a text, that he also felt sick that same night had to throw up as well. This can not be just a coincidence. It's pretty obvious to me that the burgers were responsible for us feeling sick that night and not the alcohol. I am not saying that the place is bad, however you should keep in mind that there is a potential risk of feeling sick after eating here, especially if you have a few drinks later that night. We might just have been unlucky on that day, who knows, however I probably won't come back again

I think they'd only recently opened but they clearly know what they're doing, the menu is perfect for a group of sharers (like us) amazing antipasti boards and yummy salads but also tonnes of choice if you aren't so keen on sharing too! The hosts greated us and were so attentive and so much fun. They know the city really well and gave us loads of great tips and couldn't have been more helpful. We loved it so much we headed back for a Bloody Mary fuelled brunch the next day and sat on the terrace eating, drinking, chatting, catching up and people watching in the sunshine. Just perfect. Thanks to the Amicis team, and we'll be back!!! x

title_review: Great food but very slow service
review_preview: I had business lunch today with 3 customers. The wine selection is great and must admit that the food quality is very high 8 out of 10, however, the service was VERY slow. We asked for the menus several times to take a look at...
review_full: I had business lunch today with 3 customers. The wine selection is great and must admit that the food quality is very high 8 out of 10, however, the service was VERY slow. We asked for the menus several times to take a look at the selection before the main host took our order, however, we had to wait for him to give us the menus which took around 15-20 extra minutes as he was busy at other tables, unfortunately. This was a definite bottleneck. We could have reviewed everything on the menu and made up our minds saving 20 minutes which were valuable as we only had 2 hours. In terms of food, the gambon tartare was excellent and the croquetas were also very good but there was another long wait for the steak tartar (cold dish). They brought them out to a nearby serving station and then back to the kitchen for some reason probably to wait for the hot dish. This formal synchronization of finding out ordered what and bringing out all 4 plates from the serving table to our table cost them another 10 minute unnecessary delay. I also had to ask for extra hot sauce 3 times before they brought it. This is very basic stuff and I had to wait about 10 minutes more as the rest of the table finished down their meals while I waited and before even starting. The dessert and coffee were in line with our expectations and the price paid. Basically, 237 euros later, I went home thinking that they could definitely make some basic improvements. In my opinion, they make a special effort to give a formal touch but sacrifice basic needs or listening to the customer for the money paid. They need more waiters if they want to add the formal touch and maintain a high quality aligned with the price tag. I donÂ´t mind paying money if I get excellence but didnÂ´t find it today.

review_preview: We loved the setting of Alabaster.  Exposed, but white painted brick work, juxtaposed against sleek and modern design.  Menus were available in English and service was attentive and friendly, with staff trying hard to be helpful.Freshly baked bread, croquettes and olives to nibble on...
review_full: We loved the setting of Alabaster. Exposed, but white painted brick work, juxtaposed against sleek and modern design. Menus were available in English and service was attentive and friendly, with staff trying hard to be helpful. Freshly baked bread, croquettes and olives to nibble on while we ordered were lovely. We had scallops and prawns to start; both of which were beautifully prepared and presented. Ox tail ravioli as a main was a highlight; rich and full of flavour and the mackerel with chimichuri was served medium-rare and was light, and salty. Decent wine list with some unusual choices.  Our meal was 120Euro, including a bottle of wine, which we though given the setting, location a quality of food was reasonable. Would highly recommend Alabaster for fresh, high quality dishes.

review_preview: We loved this restaurant and unusually for us ate here in consecutive days it was so good. We came across it by accident having gone to the nearby Mercado St Miguel which proved to be jam packed on Saturday lunchtime . Amicis was just round...
review_full: We loved this restaurant and unusually for us ate here in consecutive days it was so good. We came across it by accident having gone to the nearby Mercado St Miguel which proved to be jam packed on Saturday lunchtime . Amicis was just round the back with some welcome shady outside tables on a very hot day. The food was fabulous . Four of us shared a platter of meats cheese mushroom pate aubergines and a delicious tapenade and followed with the pear and goats cheese salad with fresh figs. WOWH! The house wine was great value for money and two bottles later we were very chilled. The restaurant is owned by Maria and Alex and has been open for only two weeks. They were really interested in our views and were very chatty and friendly. We returned for dinner the following evening and had glazed salmon with seafood cous cous, steak with foie and duck. Food was outstanding. This is a real gem of a restaurant, the location is superb, the food was outstanding and the decor was modern light and airy but with some interesting exposed older brickwork. We loved everything about it. It's very new and the owners are very engaging and open to feedback and determined to build a successful business which will appeal to both locals and tourists. I would recommend anyone going to Madrid to give it a try you won't be disappointed

review_full: What a delightful surprise. Joan and I were exploring a different part of Madrid when we found that Casa Jacinto [CJ] was just opening on an early Sunday afternoon. It seems we interrupted the staff meal but were welcomed cordially and pleasantly nonetheless. We were seated at a lovely table for two. Joan had an eggplant tapas that looked and tasted delicious. I had heard that Casa Jacinto had the best Cocido Madrileno in Madrid and was not disappointed--a tasty broth and an array of simmered meats and vegetables done just right, the way a Cocido Madrileno should be prepared. A very good lunch at an out-of-the-way neighborhood place. BTW, we were directed to CJ by a very friendly policeman guarding the Spanish Senate building which is nearby. It always helps to ask locals for information.

title_review: A truly enjoyable experience, #glutenfree for me
review_preview: I had never heard of this restaurant and was very surprised to learn that we would be eating in the dark. I had my reservations as I'm a celiac and I found it very disconcerting to learn that I was going to be served a...
review_full: I had never heard of this restaurant and was very surprised to learn that we would be eating in the dark. I had my reservations as I'm a celiac and I found it very disconcerting to learn that I was going to be served a meal that I could not see. However the owner MaitÃ© put me quite at ease explaining that my menu was being prepared separately. The waiter would know who I was and every precaution would be taken to make sure I felt confident that I was eating a gluten-free meal. I relaxed and went into the dining hall with my colleagues in line like we used to do in infants school. We were seated and as our eyes got used to being in the darkness the rest of our senses began to kick in. We were served a delicious three course meal which truly tested our taste buds. Until this day I had not realized just how much I rely on seeing what I am eating to decide whether I like it or not. Today, without realizing it, I ate mussels and enjoyed them. The whole experience was humbling. Prejudices have many guises and it is good to have them challenged from time to time.

review_preview: So yesterday my group visited Dans Le Noir? and I was nervous because I heard it was in the dark, like pitch black and also I have dietary restrictions, and a lot of my friends also have dietary restrictions (ex. Vegetarian, lactose intolerant, nut and...
review_full: So yesterday my group visited Dans Le Noir? and I was nervous because I heard it was in the dark, like pitch black and also I have dietary restrictions, and a lot of my friends also have dietary restrictions (ex. Vegetarian, lactose intolerant, nut and egg allergies), but as soon as I sat down and the food was served all the restrictions were met and everything was perfect. It was amazing listening and using my other senses to understand how the waiters work. Walking into the eating part of the restaurant was nerve racking because it slowly got darker until the point where it was all dark. My waiter, Jordy helped us get there and find our seats and throughout the night he remembered our names and our orders and it was very impressive. I was trying my best to make his job easier even though I had a ton of trouble finding my seat and cups and plates. You do not order your own food in this restaurant so it's basically a guessing game and you have to figure out what your eating and where it is on your plate by using your hands. I would 10/10 recommend this restaurant and in the future and I would love to go back. Being able to sit at dinner and not being able to see the people right next to me was really different and difficult and now I know how hard it is for people who have lost their sight to get around. I could barely exit the restaurant without running into the wall, so I'm not sure how people who are blind do it everyday. Thanks again Jordy you were a wonderful waiter and thank you for putting up with me and my friends during the meal when you were trying to serve us.

review_preview: What a great restaurant and amazing vibe in Amicis. It is my first time in Madrid and  Amicis and I loved it. Fabio and Maria are amazing hosts, very knowledgeable and friendly and have great tips and advice for everything. From what to eat, what's...
review_full: What a great restaurant and amazing vibe in Amicis. It is my first time in Madrid and Amicis and I loved it. Fabio and Maria are amazing hosts, very knowledgeable and friendly and have great tips and advice for everything. From what to eat, what's tasty and what to drink to where to visit and what is going on! The staff are super friendly and you can see and feel that everyone enjoys working there. The decor is like a renovated old style building with exposed brick and brushed woods. I had a mediterranean sharing plate full of delicious things. Great meats, olives, cheese, an amazing baked aubergine tapas plus generous portions of bread, and some tangy olive tapenades. I also tried a bowl of herby, peppery, olive oily cous-cous that was super tasty. For me this was all washed down with a couple of beers. I tried both the taps, a dark beer and a lager. They have this cool beer delivery system there with enormous static barrels of beer. It tastes lovely! I am pretty interested in beer so Fabio kindly explained the system to me.  So yeah, really worth visiting. Thoroughly recommended. I just wish I had more time in Madrid to go again and try some other things on the menu. Thank you everyone!

review_full: Everything about this meal was awful. We went to Goiki two nights ago and had a fantastic burger. (See my review). This was the polar opposite. The service was dreadful, no one was interested. The staff were having a chat amongst themselves. Our order was completely mixed up. I'd ordered a doubled up Tijuana burger (Tijuana seemed to consist of a thin scraping guacamole on my bread with a few chillies sprinkled on), my partner ordered a single La Pampa burger. She got the doubled up one instead of me! And I think she got my sour cream? I'd had cabbage salad with mine. It smelled and tasted funny and j didn't like it. I love coleslaw. My partner had the baked potatoes. They were just boiled potatoes! The burgers were cold. Ok, we'd both ordered "rare" but they were actually cold. At Goiki we'd ordered rare and they were cooked rare, not just cold. If you're thinking about going here, don't. Go to Goiki and enjoy your meal instead

title_review: Amazing! Experience not to be missed.
review_preview: I love Madrid. One of my favourite cities in the world and I never thought it could get any better until I came across Amicis, looking for supper with a small group of friends in October. We were immediately wowed by the very cool, trendy...
review_full: I love Madrid. One of my favourite cities in the world and I never thought it could get any better until I came across Amicis, looking for supper with a small group of friends in October. We were immediately wowed by the very cool, trendy and welcoming interiors and the lovely, Maria, the restaurantâ€™s English born co-owner and host. Sitting outside on the terrace we were immediately made to feel at home by Fabio, Amicisâ€™ other owner, who was one of the friendliest and interesting hosts Iâ€™ve ever come across. He spoke passionately about the food and wine and helped us choose a selection of dishes to pick at which is exactly what we were after. We loved absolutely everything but some dishes that stuck in my mind were the pear, goats cheese and fig salad, the roasted vegetable platter, a mixed meat and cheese platter and then to finish, a taste from home- apple crumble! We loved it so much we went back for breakfast the next morning where I had Huevos rancheros, a dish I hadnâ€™t had since studying in Mexico many moons ago. Delicious! If you want a welcoming, original, cool, friendly restaurant with exquisite food then Amicis is a must, I canâ€™t wait to return to Madrid to go back.

review_preview: The place itself is very stylish and has a very nice atmosphere. Service is quick and attentive and also friendly. I went with two other friends and we had a simple lunch of Tuna and tomato salad (very nicely elaborated with pomegrante seeds and tasty...
review_full: The place itself is very stylish and has a very nice atmosphere. Service is quick and attentive and also friendly. I went with two other friends and we had a simple lunch of Tuna and tomato salad (very nicely elaborated with pomegrante seeds and tasty tomatoes); torreznos (to die for - excellent) and then a 1.2kg t bone steak with chips. The meat was excellent, although for me it had a slightly heavy "smoky bbq" flavour. The cheescake we had (between us) for desert was also very good. It's not cheap, but for under 50 each (bottle of wine and a few beers at the start included), the value for money is good.  It IS a place I would return to if I wanted to impress.

title_review: A restaurant so worthy, we created a profile especially to review!
review_preview: My partner and I visited Amicis on Sunday after a heavy weekend supporting the mighty Reds in the Champions League, and we were blown away. For starters we shared the Steak Tartar, a generous portion, and a perfect fusion of flavours. I now am craving...
review_full: My partner and I visited Amicis on Sunday after a heavy weekend supporting the mighty Reds in the Champions League, and we were blown away.  For starters we shared the Steak Tartar, a generous portion, and a perfect fusion of flavours. I now am craving this whilst writing this review. We both had a fish dish for Mains, both dishes beautifully presented and again an interest blend of flavours. My partner rarely eats fish but was attracted to the Monkfish for its combination of elements (of which I now must try at home!) and is now a convert. I had the confit of which was cooked perfectly, it practically melts in your mouth! The desserts, Tiramisu and Apple crumble - both a perfect sized portion and again so so delicious!! If the food didn't already sound perfect, add the personable warmth and attentive nature of Fabio and you have one perfect evening! Fabio took the time to not only make suggestions for food and wines but to take interest in us as a customer.  People are always quick to complain of a bad experience, but rarely take time time to rave about the good ones so this one needs to be shared and visited.  I am so glad we chose Amicis that evening as you helped provide the perfect end to our momentous trip, so thank-you to all the team! We will be seeing you again hopefully before the end of the year :)

title_review: Great food, service a let down
review_preview: Found this restaurant upon reviewing the many thousand on Trip Advisor. The reviews were excellent and we thought we must give this restaurant a go. Warmly greeted and settled outside on the terrace, we successfully ordered our first round of drinks, and unfortunately that is...
review_full: Found this restaurant upon reviewing the many thousand on Trip Advisor. The reviews were excellent and we thought we must give this restaurant a go. Warmly greeted and settled outside on the terrace, we successfully ordered our first round of drinks, and unfortunately that is where it ended. We had to constantly get the waitresses attention to order food and more beverages, we even had to remind her that we had ordered additional items. When the food arrived, it was excellent, especially the ox tail croquettes with froie gras. Upon completion, we asked for the bill, and again received nothing having to ask a second time after waiting around 15 mins since originally asking. I would recommend this restaurant for food, but perhaps ask yourself how much time you have as you will be there a while.

title_review: Incredible food, wine, service, and presentation
review_preview: This was a dinner for seven family members, several of whom we hadn't seen for many years, so it was important to have lots of time together.  This was the perfect place.  First of all, it's a beautiful restaurant--sleek, sophisticated but comfortable.  Our server was...
review_full: This was a dinner for seven family members, several of whom we hadn't seen for many years, so it was important to have lots of time together. This was the perfect place. First of all, it's a beautiful restaurant--sleek, sophisticated but comfortable. Our server was super attentive, professional, and very friendly. But let's get to the food. We live in the US but the family is my husband's and live locally and they did the ordering of lots of small plates of typical Galician food and also the wine. Well, the plates were absolutely beautifully presented and, more importantly, so delicious! We had several different seafood plates--I have no idea what many of them were but they were all incredibly delicious. The dishes were served one at a time--the seafood, including calamari and all sorts of fish, each prepared differently, were served first. Then the plates were changed and the meats were served, again beautifully presented and delicious. One of the dishes was steak tartare, which rivaled the French version as one of the best. The desserts were also wonderful. One was a type of Napoleon and the other was a cake and fruit dessert. One of the wines we had was one of the best reds I've ever had. We were there from 9 pm until 1 am and had a wonderful time. In all, I would come back in a heartbeat! It's in a great neighborhood and is a MUST for anyone who comes to Madrid.

We had to wait for more than 30 minutes before somebody bothered to ask if we wanted to drink anything. Secondly, once they came, they almost left without taking the full order of drinks (?). We were surprised that some of the staff spoke as if they had inhaled Helium. So it felt in the end like it was kind of half-fulfilled promise. Because I think of going back, I would rate it as 4/5 rather than 3/5.

title_review: There was room to get in
review_preview: We have been to Madrid before and were there for just one night this trip.  We had wanted to eat at one of two or three other restaurants nearby that we had eaten at on our last trip.  Alas, they had no room to sit...
review_full: We have been to Madrid before and were there for just one night this trip. We had wanted to eat at one of two or three other restaurants nearby that we had eaten at on our last trip. Alas, they had no room to sit outside, and it was a hot night. After wasting some time walking around, hoping seats would open up, we ended up here. They had A/C inside and room to sit down. We ordered wine and water and expected to get a tapa of some sort along with those items. Nothing came. We found that unusual. We ordered a few tapas, none of which stood out as particularly memorable when measured against our 17 days of eating in Barcelona, Cordoba, Ronda, and Granada. The food was forgettable and the service was courteous, yet curt. Lots of tourists present, but it is the heart of a tourist city. The decor was unusual, shall we say. At least the A/C was cold!

title_review: Excellent service and utmost attention. MUST go in Chueca!
review_preview: My boyfriend and I are absolute foodies. We travel as far and wide as possible for food and wine. Current residents of Miami, we have both lived in and travelled around quite a bit and we eat out several times a week. Weâ€™re not easy...
review_full: My boyfriend and I are absolute foodies. We travel as far and wide as possible for food and wine. Current residents of Miami, we have both lived in and travelled around quite a bit and we eat out several times a week. Weâ€™re not easy to please or impress.  That being said, we both agreed that at this unpretentious but tastefully styled little restaurant, we received one of the best customer service weâ€™ve enjoyed in our lives. This is not a hyperbolic statement and if you read any of my other reviews, youâ€™ll see for yourself that I am particularly demanding (I have an undergrad in hospitality and a passion for excellent service). As soon as we sat down, delicious large olives were placed at our table. A basket full of freshly-baked artisanal bread was served while we waited for our food, which came incredibly quick. We ate wayyy too much, but it was worth it. We started off with the tomato avocado salad and the burrata-stuffed tomato. I would recommend one tomato dish (especially if you wish to try several dishes) but they were both scrumptious and fresh. Then we followed with a morcilla nigiri, very original. We also tried the butterfish, wish was smooth, tender and yummy! Food is enough to make this place worthwhile but the service was beyond exceptional. Tables are not assigned to one server, every staff member who walked by our table made sure our wine glass was full for the duration of our lunch (until we finished our bottle), it was truly astonishing, almost hilarious how we would take a sip and have one of the waiters fill up our glass within minutes.  The decor is brilliant: cozy, earthy, modern and edgy but respecting the surrounding feel of the neighborhood. Writing on my phone makes it a bit difficult to elaborate but I would go on and on about this place. If youâ€™re visiting Chueca, definitely eat here. Ah! And we were the only tourist-looking couple at the place, by the conversations I could tell this is a local joint, which is always nice.

title_review: Basil Fawlty is still in business
review_preview: After 5 days of great food and drink in a diverse range of Madrid restaurants and other quality eateries, Nimu Bistro came as a disappointment. The reluctant greeting from the Maitre'd as we walked in spot on time for our reservation came as a shock...
review_full: After 5 days of great food and drink in a diverse range of Madrid restaurants and other quality eateries, Nimu Bistro came as a disappointment. The reluctant greeting from the Maitre'd as we walked in spot on time for our reservation came as a shock after the overwhelming friendliness experienced elsewhere; situation saved by a friendly waitress who acknowledged our booking and gave us a good table. Basil Fawlty was at his most distainfull when we ordered a wine he clearly didn't approve of and he wasn't brimmy with bonhommie or helpfullness in taking our order; his fawning over regular customers provided an element of cabaret. The food was innovative, good but not the best we've had and some dishes grossly overpriced for the content.  Basil insisted we ordered dessert with the main meal; a practice that is reasonable for dishes requiring elaborate &/or timeconsuming preparation but certainly not for most items on the list. Surroundings are opulent, Nimu is based in an upmarket "boutique?" hotel, which in part justifies a premium on the prices. Verdict: Nice meal, would recommend it or consider going again. Shame as Madrid is a friendly city with great value in worldclass eateries.

review_preview: This restaurant is a new addition to the already long list of restaurants in the area, but one worth exploring. I understand that they have recently moved here from the Salamanca district. The place is light and spacious and it feels welcoming and friendly. The...
review_full: This restaurant is a new addition to the already long list of restaurants in the area, but one worth exploring. I understand that they have recently moved here from the Salamanca district. The place is light and spacious and it feels welcoming and friendly. The menu is short. Spanish with a, minor, oriental twist, that does not detract from the overall effect. We shared four dishes that could not be faulted. The cazon (cubes of marinated fish deep-fried) served with black garlic mayonnaise was the star, closely followed by the rabo de toro with parmesan cheese and a delicious tarta fina de manzana (thin apple tart). The croquetas de chipirones were also good, but lacked intensity of flavour. a very enjoyable lunch and a restaurant worth visiting again.

This place made me feel like a valued guest and this is one of my best experiences with a restaurant ( this is my first restaurant review on a tripadvisor). title_review: Excellent wait staff..  line cooks need eductaion/training
review_preview: I ordered a hamburger to be cooked, Rare.  It arrived plated nicely but, when I cut into it.. the center wasnÂ´t just raw.. it was cool to the touch... I asked the waiter to send it back to the kitchen and he was very polite...
review_full: I ordered a hamburger to be cooked, Rare. It arrived plated nicely but, when I cut into it.. the center wasnÂ´t just raw.. it was cool to the touch... I asked the waiter to send it back to the kitchen and he was very polite and apologetic. Upon return, the burger was, sadly, overcooked. Evidently, the cook decided to err on the side of well-done. Because Steakburger specializes in hamburgers, you may wish to educate and train your line cooks that, as a standard, RARE has an internal temperature of 120 - 125 degrees Farenhiet. While I would visit your restaurant again, I would expect to see greater handling and control of the product. With that said, I would like to compliment the wait staff. They were polite, attentive and, in my case, my waiter offered to return the product to the kitchen again, if I wasnÂ´t completely satisfied. I elected not to do so because my dining companions had already begun eating their meals.

review_preview: After a tour of Palacio Real de Madrid we were in search of a good place to have lunch in the surrounding area. We selected Amicis from the reviews on Trip Advisor and reserved a table. We were warmly greeted by the owners Maria and...
review_full: After a tour of Palacio Real de Madrid we were in search of a good place to have lunch in the surrounding area. We selected Amicis from the reviews on Trip Advisor and reserved a table. We were warmly greeted by the owners Maria and Fabio. We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation, while the ladies cruised the Mercado the guys sampled the local beer at the bar until our table was ready. The menu has a very nice selection of food choices. The guys shared the following: a meat board, a cheese board and a cheeseburger and fries. These items were plentiful and very good with two thumbs up on the fries and the selection of cheeses. The ladies ordered a house salad with chicken and a pear and baked goat cheese salad. They were very happy with their selections and the food quality and presentation was excellent.  We were particularity impressed with Fabio and Mariaâ€™s interaction with their customers. I believe this approach serves them well. In addition to the earlier local brew I also thought the wine selections by the glass were very good and reasonably priced. I enjoyed my red wine selection. The ladies were so impressed they returned another day for lunch. In summary a great find in a very nice area of the city.

review_preview: Me and a friend had dinner here recently.  As with many (most) Madrid restaurants, the service was slow due in part to inadequate staffing (one waiter working the entire restaurant).The burgers were good though unspectacular.  However, we ordered potato wedges which were obviously reheated...
review_full: Me and a friend had dinner here recently. As with many (most) Madrid restaurants, the service was slow due in part to inadequate staffing (one waiter working the entire restaurant). The burgers were good though unspectacular. However, we ordered potato wedges which were obviously reheated (and tasted very poor). That is unacceptable. My girlfriend ordered her burger well done but it was a medium at best and hers came with a wilted salad. And to top it off, we ordered a fruit shake, which can be more accurately described as crushed ice with sugar syrup.  As I write this, this restaurant is #100 in Madrid - laughable. Don't be fooled- this is an mediocre to below average restaurant with poor attention to detail both in the kitchen and with respect to staffing. There are countless superb restaurants in Madrid so really there is zero reason to come here.

review_preview: LOVED Rosi La Loca Taberna. This might have been one of the best meals of our trip.The restaurant is very fun and inviting, the decor is super cute and the food is even better! It is great that they offer reservations, and they were helpful...
review_full: LOVED Rosi La Loca Taberna. This might have been one of the best meals of our trip.The restaurant is very fun and inviting, the decor is super cute and the food is even better! It is great that they offer reservations, and they were helpful and accommodating when we needed to add a chair to our table last minute. Cocktails are delicious, recommend any of the mojitos and at least getting one of the Rainbow Bagged cocktails to try just for how fun they are (but sweet!). We ordered lots of tapas for the table, they even offer 'Super Tapas' for larger groups which was great. We also got the huge Ribeye steak that was enough for our group of 7 to eat, and the Surf and Turf Paella was amazing! It takes a little longer to cook but we were happy to sit and drink cocktails while we waited and it was worth it! Service was friendly and helpful, spoke good english and was able to assist a member in our group with any allergy questions.

review_preview: On our final night of our fabulous 2 1/2 weeks in Spain, we wanted to have an amazing supper experience.  Because of our chosen eating style, which makes us feel great,  finding a great spot to eat is challenging at the best of time. Our...
review_full: On our final night of our fabulous 2 1/2 weeks in Spain, we wanted to have an amazing supper experience. Because of our chosen eating style, which makes us feel great, finding a great spot to eat is challenging at the best of time.  Our search amongst the many many fabulous restaurants in the heart of Madrid took some time. The friendly hostess (see picture) at the outside of the wonderful cheerful looking restaurant Rosi La Loca greeted us and assured us that our eating style would be taken care of.  We were then served by an enthusiastic Santiago (see picture), who was very helpful in going through the menu to wade through what we could eat, and which menu items could be modified. Santiago went back to the kitchen to double check. We were very grateful that he cared so much.  Spanish wine is perfect. We ordered the red wine without specifying what kind. Santiago brought us a bottle that was produced in his home town, and talked about the wine and it's qualities. We loved the taste of the wine. The background of the wine made it special.  We settled on the Mixed Salad with mango and goat cheese. They put the cheese on a separate plate as Jill is allergic to dairy. The salad was so wonderful. The cheese was so delicious (the fact that I just admitted now).  The second dish was the Spanish Omelette, which we had not experienced yet. It was so savory, so delicate.  The third dish was the Octopus Tentacle with a celeriac sauce. Great presentation and flavour. Rosi La Loca was the highlight of the many fabulous restaurants we dined at.  Thank you Santiago for making the experience truly memorable!!!

review_preview: We went to this restaurant on a not busy hour. They gave us automatically English menus and when we were ordering, it wasn't possible to communicate with the waiter in English. Before I even had time to respond that ok I can speak Spanish, the...

Before I even had time to respond that ok I can speak Spanish, the waiter picked up another person, who was able to take our order. When I was trying to ask about the wines, the waiter just asked us if we wanted red or white wine. He didn't even listen to my question about the winelist and we ended up with a really bad glass of red wine that we didn't want to order. Then when we got our beefs, my husband's beef was very gummy, chewy and the half of it was like a hard film that he couldn't eat. Mine was almost well-done, though I asked it medium-rare. When the lady with a manager-print in her shirt came to ask how was the food and we explained that we were't happy about it, she just responded us that "well, it is beef tenderloin". Well exactly! And that's what we're paying for and what we get is a gray piece of a shoe that no one would enjoy eating. Also the fries were hard mini mini pieces of shredded potatoes and the salad was pathetic. I wouldn't even call tose two lazy leaves and a piece of tomato a salad. Anyway, they didn't make it up or be even sorry about it. We will never step again into that restaurant.

review_full: There were 12 friends in our party and we had a great table in the center of the room. The room was beautifully restored, there was a great buzz and attentive service. Food was excellent. We were a heavy drinking crowd and for two courses and coffees including very much wine and G&T's the bill was less than EUR40 per head which we felt was good value. Our party then decamped to the beautiful cocktail bar and music room downstairs where the drinks where excellent but certainly more expensive (perhaps we should not have had so many!). I wish the new owners success as they have invested in and restored a beautiful building very well.

review_preview: On our hunt to find the cloistered nuns who sell Dulces near Plaza Mayor we stumbled on Amicus. While the nuns were closed Amicis (Friends) was an equal blessing.  All alone on the little Plaza del Conde de Miranda we savored one of our best...
review_full: On our hunt to find the cloistered nuns who sell Dulces near Plaza Mayor we stumbled on Amicus. While the nuns were closed Amicis (Friends) was an equal blessing. All alone on the little Plaza del Conde de Miranda we savored one of our best meals in Spain (magret pato and salmon glaseado) and listened to impassioned stories from the multicultural owner Fabio and later his co-owner and wife Maria. The atmosphere, food and enthusiasm of the multi-ethnic staff was entertaining and welcoming. By the end of dinner we were hugged hugged and toasted and truly felt like friends. If we were in Madrid longer we'd have gone to Amicis every night.

review_preview: Was in Madrid on my birthday, didn't plan ahead and decided to try to reserve a table last minute. Was lucky to find one at Rosi la Loca (truly lucky, the place was fully booked!) at 1030pm - normal dinner hours in Madrid. We had...
review_full: Was in Madrid on my birthday, didn't plan ahead and decided to try to reserve a table last minute. Was lucky to find one at Rosi la Loca (truly lucky, the place was fully booked!) at 1030pm - normal dinner hours in Madrid. We had a lovely time, the food was delicious and well priced. Our server, Adam, was awesome, made great recommendations, and even got us the last pitcher of their special white sangria (highly recommended!). We had a few tapas (the burrata is amazing, as were the potatoes, the pork tenderloin wasn't our favorite) and the highly recommended seafood paella (which we couldn't stop eating!). All in all a great experience.. I'm usually cautious of places with too many good reviews (too good to be true thing), but this place was a great surprise.

The codfish my wife had was the best of her life and I have pork with a red wine sauce and sweet potatoes purÃ©e that tasted just as incredible as it looked.  We had a cocktail after dinner both of which were delicious as well. My wife left it to the staff to select her drink and they came back with a winner in taste and name. I mean nothing better than your new wife having a â€œSpanish pornstarâ€ befor you head back to your apartment on your honeymoon... We are only in Madrid a short time but will try to get back to Amicis again before leaving. We highly highly highly recommend you make Amicis part of your time in Madrid.  Thank you soooo much to the Amicis staff both front of house and back for making our night amazing!

title_review: The simple things done right, make this place special.
review_preview: December 3rd 2017 and we find out that this restaurant has only been open 10 weeks and is already #1 in the trip advisor ratings in Madrid. Big pressure. Huge in fact. Does it warrant it? Hard to say as Iâ€™ve not eaten in every...
review_full: December 3rd 2017 and we find out that this restaurant has only been open 10 weeks and is already #1 in the trip advisor ratings in Madrid. Big pressure. Huge in fact.  Does it warrant it? Hard to say as Iâ€™ve not eaten in every restaurant in Madrid.  What I can say is it gets a 5* rating from me.  The food is amazing, the salmon on seafood couscous is so delicate but packed full of flavour, the cheeseboard just great with a bottle of Rioja.  The atmosphere is relaxed, and mixed from couples to families enjoying good food together. Good ambience and an amazing music soundtrack to accompany your dining experience.  The team at Amicis just click. We felt like we had been invited to dinner at a friends place. This is what makes the team and experience at Amicis stand out. Youâ€™re not made to feel like just a paying customer. Youâ€™re valued, youâ€™re appreciated, youâ€™re of interest to the Amicis team.  That experienced, whether itâ€™s the intention, came across.  Highly recommended.  Well done guys. Good luck with the business.

title_review: OK Burger, but more for those who like extras on the burger.
review_preview: I ate here one Monday lunch. I had a 160g burger with a side 'salad'. The problem is this restaurant chain has a bad selection of burger sizes. The smallest is 160g followed by 250g - for me the former is too small but the...
review_full: I ate here one Monday lunch. I had a 160g burger with a side 'salad'. The problem is this restaurant chain has a bad selection of burger sizes. The smallest is 160g followed by 250g - for me the former is too small but the latter to big, where as most burger restaurants I've been to here offer a 200g size which is perfect. The meat itself was nice but the shape was more of a ball of meat than a classic patty. The next issue I had was the side dish that comes with the meal - I chose a 'salad', which was literally just coleslaw, rather disappointing if you expect salad. Though if you are someone who likes chips or backed potato these are also side options included in the price. My burger and salad came in at â‚¬8.50, which was a bit steep for the size and side I got - though if you are someone who likes extras on the burger like cheeses, caramelised onions, guacamole etc. then this might be for you as it costs the same to have a plain burger (like I did) or one with the maximum amount of extras. The next size burger up (250g) sets you back â‚¬10.50 I think. Service was fine.

title_review: Tough at the top ; but these guys have cracked it !
review_preview: Staying in our beloved city of Madrid for a month and by chance staying close by to the Numero Uno (No 1) place in the whole city , so had to visit ! On both occasions we were welcomed so warmly and honestly it was...
review_full: Staying in our beloved city of Madrid for a month and by chance staying close by to the Numero Uno (No 1) place in the whole city , so had to visit !  On both occasions we were welcomed so warmly and honestly it was hard to believe we were actually in a city centre bar/eatery. The owners have made it part of their mission to speak , yes , speak to their clients which a lot of places sometimes forget . Ok, it must be tough being in the hospitality business in the city , just look around at the amount of competition, and trying to please everyone ; the bane of their lives , but hey ; itâ€™s why most people go out - to enjoy, communicate and interact .  Such time spent goes a long way and by the reaction of other reviewers ; time much appreciated. A lovely chic , modern place with food to match . Nothing pretentious and very reasonably priced . All in all - what more can you ask for? Situated in a lively and nice part of the city , next to the uber fashionable Mercado San Miguel , Amicis is well worth seeking out for a drink or meal. Tough it out guys and keep up the good work. Abrazos J y A

title_review: Authentic charm and an enjoyable meal

The wait staff was gracious, but English was limited â€¦ but do not let that get you down .. make an effort to read the menu and you'll be rewarded â€¦ lovely gazpacho with fresh "guarnichon" of additional vegetables to give it some crunch â€¦ an excellent bit of sausage while you wait for your meal â€¦ wonderful bread â€¦ I had the lamb chops which were sadly cooked a bit more than I prefer but excellently seasoned; my friend had fish of the day which was spot on, perfectly cooked and fresh as can be. WE shared a plate of their housemade truffles for dessert â€¦ there were 5 pieces of incredibly rich chocolate â€¦ my friend and I looked at each other .. and cut the odd one in half â€¦ sooooo good , we had coffee , house wine and their kind gesture of a digestif after, a "house brew" with a hint of brandy. Go, relax, be happy you're in an authentic place with none of the rush/noise/hubbub of the tourist joints! and get the truffles â€¦ OMG!

title_review: Cozy, No Nonsense Meal - Feeling Replete & Relaxed
review_preview: A practical place to get a solid meal at a bargain price. Cozy, compact and well occupied eatery (a good sign). Homey. Three of us, ordered salads (generous servings), "hamburguesa con beicon" (fairly large hamburger, sesame seed bun, melted cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato with mayonnaise),...
review_full: A practical place to get a solid meal at a bargain price. Cozy, compact and well occupied eatery (a good sign). Homey. Three of us, ordered salads (generous servings), "hamburguesa con beicon" (fairly large hamburger, sesame seed bun, melted cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato with mayonnaise), two delicious baguettes, two caÃ±as (draught beer) and soft drink. The menu offers a very reasonable variety of food; hot dogs, burgers, "pulgas" (small sandwiches), "traditional tapas", salads and baguettes. Glad we stopped here. Two minute walk west of the "Paseo del Prado" on the edge of "Las Letras" district, maybe a four minute jaunt to the northwest of the "Caixa Forum Madrid." Again, nothing fancy, but if you're hungry for a solid, simple meal, at an excellent price, and you are in the "neighborhood", you might want to give it a go. I love the down-to-earth atmosphere here, plain and simple! I shall return.

review_preview: I had eaten at Casa Jacinto on a previous trip to Madrid so I was excited to take my husband here on his first trip to Spain. Seriously delicious- I've never had a bad dish here and he exclaimed it was the best meal of...
review_full: I had eaten at Casa Jacinto on a previous trip to Madrid so I was excited to take my husband here on his first trip to Spain. Seriously delicious- I've never had a bad dish here and he exclaimed it was the best meal of his trip (we were also in Barcelona and Granada). Non spanish speakers be warned- although one of the waiters speaks some English don't expect a fully english interaction. Bring your spanish reference book or look at their menu online so you know what's what on the menu. (They do have a menu in English but I don't believe the order of dishes completely matches up) A table next to us ordered the tripe and when it came out they claimed they wanted the lambchops- very different things- the waiter handled it wonderfully (not so much the diners) and returned with new entrees for them.  Our experience was wonderful (despite not speaking much spanish) as you can tell the staff (including the chef) really care about their customers- attentive but not hoovering, quick to refill drinks, and included an after dinner drink for free. The food is cooked to order and are quality ingredients. I disagree with the other reviewer who said it was pricey- I think they could charge more for the quality and portions. I wish we had a "Casa Jacinto" back home in our neighborhood! I will always return when in Madrid.

title_review: We will be back on our next visit to Madrid!
review_preview: The apartment where we stayed in Madrid had a binder with recommended restaurants.  My husband, granddaughter and I decided on Casa Jacinto because it was described as "traditional Spanish cuisine".  It was the best meal we had in Madrid.  We liked the tastefully decorated dining...
review_full: The apartment where we stayed in Madrid had a binder with recommended restaurants. My husband, granddaughter and I decided on Casa Jacinto because it was described as "traditional Spanish cuisine". It was the best meal we had in Madrid. We liked the tastefully decorated dining room, and our server was in the old style of table service, welcoming, attentive yet unobtrusive. We had the salmorejo, setas con jamon, entrecot, solomillo, chuletas de cordero - all authentically and succulently prepared. The accompanying fried potatoes were absolutely delicious. At the end of our meal, our server brought us complimentary digestifs. Thank you, Casa Jacinto for a wonderful dining experience!

review_full: Jacinto is at the helm, confident in trusting the expert cooking hands of his wife at the backstage. Service is always attentive and friendly with willingness to please. The place is small and warm, a typical Madrid tavern with reference to the Spanish fiesta, matadors paintings presided by a bulls head in the front wall reminding the guests you are in Spain.  The food may be considered basic Spanish but well prepared and tasty. There is enough variety in the menu to entice you for a second visit.  The "Lomo a a la sal" Ox sliced stake served almost raw to cook yourself to your own taste on a clay plate is a delicious main dish that would meet the agreement of beef eaters. Good wine selection and all a reasonable prices.  Call, make a reservation and enjoy it  After lunch or dinner walk around the block and admire the splendor of the Royal Palace, its gardens and the Opera House. It's a winnerâ€™s evening!

review_full: We first visited this traditional restaurant in 2010, and returned seven years later to celebrate my wife's birthday. The restaurant, which is a decorated in bullfighting paraphernalia and transports you to a bygone era, lived up to all our memories and expectations. Arriving at 8 p.m., we had the restaurant practically to ourselves for our entire meal. The two servers were extremely attentive and solicitous, making excellent dining recommendations. Among the wonderful dishes we had were grilled fresh vegetables, clams with mushrooms, grilled hake collar, and an entrecot. The servers brought us a special dessert to celebrate my wife's birthday. To finish the evening the servers treated us to a Crema de Orujo, a homemade brandy drink. We highly recommend this restaurant for its food, atmosphere, and service.

title_review: The best of our three week trip to Spain. Don't miss it.
review_preview: We heard about this place through friends. Though in a kind of touristy area near the puerta del sol it is truly not to be missed. One of our best meals anywhere! People there are super nice as the food is glorious. Don't be fooled...
review_full: We heard about this place through friends. Though in a kind of touristy area near the puerta del sol it is truly not to be missed. One of our best meals anywhere! People there are super nice as the food is glorious. Don't be fooled be the casual look of the place the tapas and food is wonderful and surprisingly sophisticated! It's hard to say what was best. Don't miss the octopus under a glass dome of smoke. The tuna is superb. And the pork tenderloin and the chicken wings. The sardines on a clothesline looked great too. They come out with a torch and sear them. We also had a wonderful goat cheese salad. We had four large tapas, a bottle of wine and cocktails for 2 for 50 euros! The people there are very nice and accommodating too. Reservations are probably best but we didn't have any. Really really a memorable meal all around. Palate, price and people the best. If you come there with more people you can share more. The tapas are large enough for that. One of the places I'll always remember eating in.

title_review: Fab food, cool cocktails & lovely people!
review_preview: On a short trip to Madrid this has become a firm favourite for my partner and I. After popping in for a drink one day, followed by a delicious lunch the next (see separate review from Kate), last night we went the whole hog and...
review_full: On a short trip to Madrid this has become a firm favourite for my partner and I. After popping in for a drink one day, followed by a delicious lunch the next (see separate review from Kate), last night we went the whole hog and called in for dinner. As usual, Maria and Fabio together with the rest of their team were amazing hosts. We started with some fab cocktails, mine being an unusual smokey take on a Marguerita made with Mezcal while Kate had an amazing version of a pornstar martini. For dinner we started with favourites from a previous visit, burrata with tomatoes and delicious fresh pesto together with exquisite poached eggs with Parmesan, bolatas and truffle oil. For mains Kate went for a beautifully cooked fillet steak, rubbed in wasabi, which gave it a lovely kick and I had a fantastic piece of duck with poached pear and a sweet Marsala wine sauce. Wow! Food is superb owners and staff are lovely and the surroundings are great. I would certainly recommend you add Amicis to your itinerary the next time youâ€™re in Madrid.

Maria was such a lovely and welcoming host on our first day that we were back again the next day for lunch.  Maria recommended some lovely wine for me (AlbariÃ±o) and Fabio suggested a great IPA for my partner.  On day 2 we had burrata with pesto and tomatoâ€™s, aubergine with parmesan and poached egg in parmesan with truffle oil and boletus (wild mushrooms) as our starters. All were gorgeous and would definitely recommend. Then we had the seafood paella which was stunning. For dessert I had cheesecake and my partner had a lovely chocolate coulant. Both desserts were delicious. We loved it at Amicis- fabulous service, a lovely welcome and great food. Definitely worth a visit. While you are there check out the downstairs dining room - dates back to the Spanish Inquisition and now a great function room for the restaurant.  If you are in Madrid go spend a few hours here - you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

review_preview: My friend and I went here to celebrate my birthday, and I really enjoyed the food. The place had nice interior decor with a theme of lots of floral/bright colours.The waiter made us change our minds on our order after he recommended the cheese...
review_full: My friend and I went here to celebrate my birthday, and I really enjoyed the food. The place had nice interior decor with a theme of lots of floral/bright colours. The waiter made us change our minds on our order after he recommended the cheese dish (I can't remember the name, but to describe it it was like mozzarella injected with pesto and a tomato/oil base, which you then mixed together and enjoyed with bread). It was really tasty and complimented our other hot tapas dish choices well. We also shared the grill beef steak which was cooked lovely and medium rare, although I have to admit it did taste a little bit chewy. The croquetas and aubergine in honey were also great choices. The menu isn't too large but offers lots of traditional Spanish tapas choices. The service was also good, we had an American waiter who was friendly and it showed that he wanted us to have an enjoyable experience at Rosi's. I would recommend this restaurant as it's an independent choice rather than chain and a great place to enjoy some tapas.

title_review: A friendly and fabulous Madrid gem!
review_preview: My family and I visited Madrid for some birthday celebrations and decided to book Amicis after reading the positive reviews online; we were not disappointed. On our first visit we reserved a table as we didnâ€™t want to miss out on a space at this...
review_full: My family and I visited Madrid for some birthday celebrations and decided to book Amicis after reading the positive reviews online; we were not disappointed. On our first visit we reserved a table as we didnâ€™t want to miss out on a space at this very popular restaurant, which is centrally located but in a lovely quiet square. I know that I wonâ€™t be the first reviewer to say that we were greeted very warmly by the owner Fabio, who immediately had our three children and us laughing and smiling with his friendly manner. The hostess and severs were also a lovely bunch and having visited many other restaurants in Madrid during our numerous visits to this lovely city, we found this to be a unique and very special experience. The building has been lovingly renovated, beautifully decorated and was very warm and inviting. Our drinks order was taken swiftly with lots of recommendations for my husband and I on the wine list and for our children, who each selected a delicious smoothie (six thumbs up from the kids!). When it came time to order our food were talked through the menu by our server, who pulled up a chair to do so, making sure that our picky youngest child got exactly everything that he likes for his meal; this was a lovely touch and made us feel very relaxed and at ease. My husband and I shared a tapas platter and also shared two main meals of Octopus and Sirloin steak. Each dish was delicious. The children had â€œthe best burger everâ€ and a chicken salad (fussy child). Only clean plates left our table. Throughout service each server that came to our table was very smiley and attentive, and we were also visited by both Fabio and lovely Maria who both made sure that we were having the best experience (ten thumbs up this time!). My husband and I ordered Tiramasu for dessert, and had a fork fight over the last mouthful, it was that good! In summary, I would visit Amicis next time we came to Spain, even if we werenâ€™t staying in Madrid! It was a unanimous vote to visit on the last day of our holiday for Sunday brunch, to be fair, there really was not another restaurant that came close!

title_review: Good food, good value, great friendly service
review_preview: Oven Las Tablas feels like a neighborhood restaurant. The sort of place your family might go every week for a standing date. The menu is definitely Italian: pizzas, pasta, starters, some meat. But it has a comfortable, homey atmosphere. A five minute walk from the...
review_full: Oven Las Tablas feels like a neighborhood restaurant. The sort of place your family might go every week for a standing date. The menu is definitely Italian: pizzas, pasta, starters, some meat. But it has a comfortable, homey atmosphere. A five minute walk from the Las Tablas metro station (line 10).  The food was good, I don't think we understood just how seriously they took the "Mozzarella Bar" concept when we ordered the "Oven Burrata", that was a HUGE hunk of cheese. The sampler platter had more Burrata, and there was Mozz on my pizza too. My wife had the Lobster Ravioli, which was good, but quite heavy. The wine was excellent and only 3euros a glass. Service was by the manager Julio who was attentive and friendly but not intrusive. This is an English friendly restaurant even though the staff speaks only a little... they tried and did not make us feel bad when our Spanish was not clear. Our whole bill, for two starters, two mains, bread, two coffees, three wines and two cokes was 63 euros. Very good value, and we could have gotten out for much less if we weren't celebrating and felt like stuffing our face. If you are in or near Las Tablas, its a cool neighborhood with some nice restaurants, its worth walking past some of them to find Oven.

I would say their specialty is not in their sushi but their taco with the slither of eel was genius. (It may well be written as a burrito on the menu). Finally the bao langostino was perfect.  There was also a decent selection of gins and herbal teas. The interior was just amazing and clean, our favourite restaurant in Madrid and I would love to come back.

review_preview: Walked into a completely empty restaurant.   My wife and I speak Spanish (hers is flawless but my accent is better), and so we very rarely run into the anti-tourist nonsense some people do.  Asked for a table for two, random dude behind the counter said...
review_full: Walked into a completely empty restaurant. My wife and I speak Spanish (hers is flawless but my accent is better), and so we very rarely run into the anti-tourist nonsense some people do.  Asked for a table for two, random dude behind the counter said esperate and vanished. Waitress told us we could have the one high top that looked out of place among the tables, I figured what the heck, it's a paella place, maybe reservations since paella service can take quite a while.  Nope. After poor service, paella with tons less seafood in it that the other two tables (yes two, the restaurant sat 80% empty for our entire meal), shoddy appetizers, and a nice trash talk in the back about my wife asking if they any hot sauce for the blandish paella (Spanish staff apparently, didn't get the we spoke Spanish) we gave up.  Don't go. Unless you're Spanish!

review_full: We decided on our last night in Madrid to have pasta instead of our steady diet of Spanish food.  Bresca was nearby and we thought â€œyou canâ€™t go wrong with pasta.â€  Pleasant ambience. Very cheerful and helpful Venezuelan waitress helped us with our wine choice.  I had the â€œMia Mamaâ€ spaghetti which was very very good.  Perfectly al dente spaghetti. Great sauce.  But my wife was the clear winner with the â€œGenoveseâ€  So simple but once again perfectly al dente. And a really beautiful pesto and oil sauce.  So flavourful that we would have come back the next night and the next night after that just to have the Genovese.  Alas we were leaving Madrid the next day.  But if youâ€™re not leaving Madrid the next day and you want a break from Spanish food, come eat here.  Folks...this is really really good pasta. Just goes to show you.  Simple is best.

title_review: Oasis tucked away in a non-descript street. Delicious delicate Basque cuisine
review_preview: 3 blocks back from Alcala and the Plaza de Toros, a door off an almost bleak street opens into a cosy but elegant dining room with well spaced tables. Real menus (!) as well as online.We started with pimentos confitados con morcilla de puerro...
review_full: 3 blocks back from Alcala and the Plaza de Toros, a door off an almost bleak street opens into a cosy but elegant dining room with well spaced tables. Real menus (!) as well as online. We started with pimentos confitados con morcilla de puerro - surprisingly light and delicate even though our Spanish host warned it would be strong - and a fried fish smaller than boquerones , again beautifully and lightly cooked. Then we shared rodabollo al horno - tender, cooked to perfection - and a delicious hongos con huevos (not the revuelto de setas on the menu). The chef sent a postre (Goxua?) which complimented the meal. Super proprietor/chef and staff. We were invited but I would estimate about E90 including a decent wine and coffee for 3. Will be back and there is more to explore in the neighbourhood. PS parking is very hard even in the pandemic. Take a taxi or walk from the metro - several spots for a drink in the way
